resources.string: "IoT City app allows you to get information from sensors from several different types, spread all over the cities." "You can see the values from the sensors closer to you displayed on the dashboard, which is the home page."
"You have a side menu bar that you can open by clicking the top left corner button."

"The map is where you can see the sensors represented in the map. The red balloon marker will represent your current location." "Each type of sensor is represented by an icon. If you have doubts regarding which icon represents which sensor, check the dashboard;" "there, in each square of each metric you will find the respective icon."
"Clicking in a sensor icon you can see the data being gathered by it."
"You can also filter which sensors appear on the map. For that, simply check/uncheck the checkbox of the type of sensors you do/don't want to appear in the map.\n"

"Clicking in the window that appears over the sensor, you are redirected to report screen, where you can report a problem regarding that sensor.\n" "In this screen you must indicate the subject of the report, the problem in plain text, your name and your e-mail address. All this in the respective fields." "You can also attach photos or videos by clicking on the camera or video icon, respectively.\n" "After providing all necessary information, click in the button "Send" to send the report."

"You can also filter which metrics appear in the dashboard. For that, just click in the "pen" button in the top right corner on the home screen." "Then check/uncheck the metrics you do/don't want to appear in the dashboard. To make all of the metrics visible again, check the checkbox - Al visible."
"As an example, if you uncheck the temperature and lighting metrics, your dashboard will look like the following image."

"To show details of any metric you have two options: open the side menu and click in the respective metric, or, while being in the dashbaord, click in the respective box of the metric.\n" "You will be redirected to the screen represented in the next image. You will have a graph showing the past data retrieved by all the temperature sensors, and bellow a graph " "with three columns: the identification code of the sensor; a checkbox to hide/show the data of the sensor represented in the graph (if uncheck/checked, respectively), the colour of the checkbox is the colour in which the sensor data is represented on the graphic; a button that will redirect you to the map and show you the location of the sensor;" " the last time the sensor retrieved a value; and the last value retrieved."
